highlights: Lead user interface (UI) engineering and manage 2 developers working on web applications for Nike's new global events platform.
Architected and led front-end development on the website for Microsoft's just-launched Surface tablet.
Coded parts of the data-driven UI for the then-new Nike+ FuelBand fitness tracker's web application.
Promoted twice, from Senior Presentation Code Developer and Front End Solutions Architect.
Developed client-side code for the first Adobe web application (Marketplace) to offer extensions and other add-ons for the company's Air and Photoshop applications.
Contributed as a UI engineer to Lexus.com and other websites for related brands Toyota and Scion.
Created the UIs for patient education websites for Amgen's top-selling rheumatoid arthritis drug Enbrel.
Built emails and launched large campaigns for Amgen and Sprint; analyzed resulting data.

work.company: Office of Educational Technology, UC San Francisco School of Medicine
highlights: Created content for sites and administered calendars and online courses for the UCSF medical community.
Provided hands-on technology support for medical school classroom instructors' hardware and software needs.
Developed user interface for online courses about a wide variety of subjects offered by UC Berkeley's Extension program.
Organized and edited online course content.
